review_title: Great place to teach and mentor college students
job_title: Instructor in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: - School schedule - Fall, Thanksgiving, Christmas, Spring, and summer breaks - Christian community - invest in students both intellectually and spiritually
cons: - hard, long hours required to prep new courses

job_title: Director of Development in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: Very transparent in operations and decision making. Employees are treated very well at every level and department. Access to leadership. Ideas and opinions are heard. Great benefits in terms of 401k match, Vacation/PTO, Excellent, caring support and work environment.
cons: Lower salary than at many institutions. Limited growth potential.

review_title: Working with students through 1-1 interactions and programming to create community.
job_title: Resident Assistant in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: JBU deeply cares for their employees and students. I was poured into and valued as both.
cons: Sometimes not having set hours.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: The mission is strong. Overall, great place to work.
cons: Pay is a little low. Turnover is higher than it used to be.

review_title: Great place to sharpen yourself but the roles are made to leave
job_title: Media Producer in Siloam Springs, AR
pros:
-Great place to sharpen your skills. There was a lot of freedom to explore how you can improve your craft and educate yourself. 
-The people you work with are top-notch. The idea that I had a life outside of work was honored well.
-management is open to feedback
-solid benefits
-a lot of momentum to be inclusive and equips you to to be culturally intelligent
cons:
-Summers are rough and a motivation killer
-feedback usually didn't fruit in results
-Leadership openness to change is lacking
-no movement for entry-level roles
-pay is minimal

job_title: Grounds Crew Worker in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: Easy work, good people, management's changed a bit from what I remember
cons: Christian environment can be weird to navigate, but that's what you're signing up for.

job_title: Mail Room Assistant in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: Great people to talk to and great supervisors.
cons: You get what you work for

review_title: JBU has so much potential, but they need to listen to what the students really want and need.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: JBU has some good people there. The President generally has a good heart, and cares for people. The students are generally happy with the education and environment currently. They try hard to hold true to their convictions while also acknowledging that it is no longer 1919...not always successfully, but they try.
cons: Some of the Administration seem to be doing their own little game of playing political games with no real regard for the employees, students, or JBU at large. Old ideas and plans have no place in this new world. Things that could help JBU be successful in the future are dismissed with false narratives to accommodate greed and selfishness. That is sad and does not bode well for JBU having a smooth path forward in this new world. I hope they can rid themselves of these old ideas and men who do not truly care how their actions affect others. We have lost a lot of Faculty and Staff who truly care about the students and JBU because of these administrative games.

review_title: A flexible of income, but not great pay.
job_title: Work Study Student in Fayetteville, AR
pros: Flexible Hours, so you can work while being a student.
cons: Paid less than minimum wage as a work study student.

job_title: Sports Photographer in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: Work with really great staff and students

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: Love everything about this place.

review_title: Great Opportunity for Personal Growth and Learning
job_title: Resident Assistant (RA) in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: Residence Life at JBU genuinely cares about the wellbeing of their students!
cons: RAs are paid a stipend, which would translate to low hourly-pay. However, being an RA is just as much a ministry and privilege as it is a job!

job_title: Custodial Worker in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: good pay, willing to give overtime, made really great friends working here
cons: incredibly boring and scrubbing dorms isn't fun.

job_title: Grounds Crew Worker in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: Nice People and community. Super chill environment
cons: Not much of a downside to the job. It's a good summer job

job_title: Assistant Coach in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: Great culture and environment within the athletics department
cons: Lots of time in meetings that could be done in half the time

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: I have loved my coworkers. I had no problem getting to know my hall and feel like I can be myself.
cons: The pay as a graduate assistant is just enough to live off of.

job_title: Professor in Siloam Springs, AR
pros:
Great Faculty Colleagues & Students
Wonderful location for interaction with Fortune 500 and Fast Growing organizations
Like the diversity of the student population
cons: Currently lacks doctoral studies programs

job_title: Marketing Manager in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: Love the people and culture here. Great work life balance.
cons: Compensation is low. Growth opportunities small.

job_title: Senior Envrionment Analyst in Dublin, CA
pros: I like the job a lot
cons: Office work isnt for everyone

job_title: Chemistry Lab Assistant in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: A very educated and loving group of people.
cons: Not the most organized group.

review_title: Overall a pleasant place to work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: Good people, energetic, positive environment, less politics than most higher ed employers, supportive management, verbally value your skills. Overall pleasant place to work.
cons: As with most private higher ed, the pay is not nearly what it should be, so while you are verbally valued, your pay does not reflect that. Also since it is a private Christian College, there are standards you have to promise to live by and things you *have* to do like attend a church regularly, and be a constant Christ-like example. 'Sins' like divorce are not tolerated and you can lose your job over them.

job_title: Teacher's Assistant in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: Great community of students and faculty, good hours, and work which is also great experience in one's field. It is very convenient to work on campus.
cons: Workstudy positions only last the 4 years, and the first must be spent in a low-level job such as custodian.

review_title: Horrible University that treats faculty unfairly.
job_title: Assistant Professor in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: No pros.  Don't work here.  I was a faculty member.  Job security is based solely on student evaluations which is a twisted use of the evaluations.
cons: Absolutely no faculty development.  Faculty have no say on University decisions.  Evaluations based on how much you can please the students.  I knew faculty who put together study sessions on a regular basis and bribed the students with pizza or donuts.  Student pandering is disgusting.  Faculty turn over is at least 25%.

job_title: Communications Manager in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: This is a workplace that encourages good work-life balance. The community here is great and I have a lot of autonomy in my job.
cons: It's a non-profit, so pay is less than surrounding companies, but benefits are good. Not a lot of positions to grown into unless you have a doctorate.

job_title: Director of Career Development in Siloam Springs, AR
pros: Christ centered, Biblical principles and foundation, Spiritual formation
cons: Diversity slightly reflects the community the campus is in. The campus lacks cultural awareness and competence and could be more intentional in staying alert and  prayerfully engaged in the realities of the world we live in.

review_title: It is very easy to work with the faculty members and staff.

Friendly environment.
